verses.content: After I, Nephi, finished teaching my brothers, our father Lehi also spoke to them. He talked about the great things the Lord had done. The Lord had brought them out of the land of Jerusalem.
He spoke about when they rebelled on the sea. He talked about how God was kind and saved their lives. They were not swallowed up in the sea.
He also talked about the promised land they had gotten. The Lord was kind to warn us to leave Jerusalem.
He said: "I have seen a vision. I know that Jerusalem is destroyed. If we had stayed in Jerusalem, we would have died."

He said: "We had hard times. But we got a promised land. This land is better than all other lands. The Lord God promised me this land for my children. The Lord promised this land to me and my children forever. He also promised it to all people he brings out of other countries."
"So I, Lehi, prophesy. The Spirit in me tells me this. No one will come to this land unless the Lord brings them."

"So this land is set apart for those he brings. If they serve him and follow his commands, it will be a land of freedom for them. They will never be taken captive. Unless they do wrong. If they do lots of wrong, the land will be cursed. But for good people, it will be blessed forever."
"It is wise that other nations don't know about this land yet. Many nations would rush to the land. There would be no place for us to live."

"So I, Lehi, got a promise. If the people the Lord God brings from Jerusalem keep his commands, they will do well in this land. They will be kept from all other nations. They can have this land to themselves. If they keep his commands, they will be blessed in this land. No one will bother them. No one will take away their land. They will live safely forever."

"But when the time comes that they stop believing, after they have gotten such great blessings from the Lordâ€”they know about the creation of the earth. They know all the wonderful works of the Lord since the world was created. They have power to do all things by faith. They have all the commands from the beginning. They were brought by his goodness to this special promised land. If the day comes that they reject the Holy One of Israel, the true Messiah, their Savior and their God, then God's fair judgments will come on them."
"Yes, he will bring other nations to them. He will give those nations power. He will take away their land. He will cause them to be scattered and hurt."
"Yes, from one generation to another, there will be wars. There will be great troubles among them. So, my sons, I want you to remember. I want you to listen to my words."

"Oh, I wish you would wake up! Wake up from a deep sleep. Wake up from the sleep of hell. Shake off the awful chains that tie you up. These chains tie up all people. They carry people away as prisoners to the pit of sadness and pain."
"Wake up! Get up from the dust! Hear the words of your shaking parent. Soon you must put my body in the cold and quiet grave. No traveler can return from there. In a few more days, I will die."
"But the Lord has saved my soul from hell. I have seen his glory. I am wrapped forever in the arms of his love."
"I want you to remember to follow the rules and judgments of the Lord. This has worried my soul from the beginning."
"My heart has been sad from time to time. I have been afraid because your hearts are hard. I fear the Lord your God might come in full anger against you. You might be cut off and destroyed forever."
"Or you might be cursed for many generations. You might be attacked with swords. You might starve. People might hate you. You might be led by the Devil's will as his prisoners."
"Oh my sons, I hope these things don't happen to you. I hope you can be a special and loved people of the Lord. But his will be done. His ways are always right."
"He has said: If you keep my commands, you will do well in the land. But if you don't keep my commands, you will be cut off from me."

"I want my soul to be happy about you. I want my heart to leave this world with gladness because of you. I don't want to go to the grave with sadness and sorrow. Get up from the dust, my sons. Be men. Be united in your thinking. Be united in your hearts. Be united in all things. Then you won't become prisoners."
"Then you won't be badly cursed. You won't make a fair God upset with you. You won't be destroyed. Your soul and body won't be destroyed forever."
"Wake up, my sons! Put on the armor of being good. Shake off the chains that tie you up. Come out of darkness. Get up from the dust."

"Stop rebelling against your brother. His views have been wonderful. He has kept the commands since we left Jerusalem. God used him to bring us to the promised land. Without him, we would have died of hunger in the wilderness. But you tried to kill him. He has been very sad because of you."

"I am very afraid and shake because of you. I'm afraid he might suffer again. You have accused him of wanting power and control over you. But I know he has not wanted power or control over you. He has wanted the glory of God and your eternal good."

"You have complained because he has been direct with you. You say he has been sharp. You say he has been angry with you. But his sharpness was the sharpness of God's word in him. What you call anger was the truth from God. He couldn't hold it back. He had to speak boldly about your sins."
"God's power must be with him. That's why he commands you to obey. But it was not him. It was the Spirit of the Lord in him. The Spirit opened his mouth to speak. He couldn't shut it."

"Now, my son Laman, and also Lemuel and Sam, and my sons who are the sons of Ishmael: If you listen to Nephi's voice, you will not die. If you listen to him, I give you a blessing. I give you my first blessing."
"But if you don't listen to him, I take away my first blessing. I take away my blessing. It will go to him instead."
"Now, Zoram, I speak to you. You are the servant of Laban. But you were brought out of Jerusalem. I know you are a true friend to my son Nephi forever."

"Because you have been faithful, your children will be blessed with his children. They will do well for a long time in this land. Nothing except their own sin will hurt them or disturb their success in this land forever."
"So if you keep the Lord's commands, the Lord has set apart this land. It is for the safety of your children with my son's children."
